filters.title: american revolution and its era: maps and charts of north america and the west indies, 1750-1789
des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
france. dépôt des cartes et plans de la marine

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 1, with some 170 items; originally bound in 3 narrow folio volumes. Vol. 2, has general t.p. dated 1780, and 3 sectional title pages dated 1781, 1780, and 1780 respectively. Charts dated 1774 to 1782. L.C. copy imperfect: General and sectional title pages and contents leaf to v. 1 wanting. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: v. 1. The sea coast of Nova Scotia.--v. 2. Charts of the coast and harbours in the Gulph & River of St. Lawrence. Charts of the coast and harbors of New England. Charts of several harbours, and divers parts of the coast of North America, from New York south westwards to the Gulph of Mexico.
contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
medium: 2 v. in 4. illus., charts, plates (part col.) 84 x 36 cm. (v. 2, pts. 2-3, 84 cm.)
notes: L.C. copy no. 1, with some 170 items; originally bound in 3 narrow folio volumes.
Vol. 2, has general t.p. dated 1780, and 3 sectional title pages dated 1781, 1780, and 1780 respectively.
Charts dated 1774 to 1782.
L.C. copy imperfect: General and sectional title pages and contents leaf to v. 1 wanting.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
repository: Library of Congress Geography and Map Division Washington, D.C. 20540-4650 USA dcu

north america

pictorial works
results.title: The Atlantic Neptune,

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 2, with 119 items. Charts dated 1774 to 1781. Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents. The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume. The contents leaf for pt. 2 calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent. The contents for pt. 3 lists 23 charts; this listing is replaced by a manuscript list of 40 charts, tipped in over the printed list. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: pt. 1. The coasts and harbours of the British Colonies in North America ....--pt. 2. The coasts and harbours in and around the Gulph and River of St. Lawrence.--pt. 3. The coasts and principal harbours of the American States ....
contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
notes: L.C. copy no. 2, with 119 items.
Charts dated 1774 to 1781.
Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents.
The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume.

The contents leaf for pt. 2 calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent.
The contents for pt. 3 lists 23 charts; this listing is replaced by a manuscript list of 40 charts, tipped in over the printed list.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 7: v. 2 only, with 27 items. Charts dated 1776 to 1781. Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents. The contents leaf for pt. 2 calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent. L.C. copy imperfect: v. 1 and 3 wanting. Includes chart of Plymouth Bay, which belongs in pt. 3. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: L.C. copy no. 8, with 123 items. Charts dated 1775 to 1781. Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents. The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume. The contents leaf for pt. 2 calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent. Includes 2 separate plates of views. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 9, with 103 items. Charts dated 1775 to 1781. Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents. The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume. The contents leaf for pt. 2. calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent. Pt. 1 contains a text printed on a full size sheet headed "To the King's Most Excellent Majesty." It is signed J. F. W. Des Barres and relates to his appointment in 1784 to the governorship of Cape Breton. It is not recorded in the Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Pt. 1 contains also the "Preface." L.C. copy imperfect: Title pages and prelim. leaves, except the leaf of "References," wanting in pts. 1 and 2. Includes 14 separate plates of views. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
notes: L.C. copy no. 9, with 103 items.
Charts dated 1775 to 1781.
Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents.
The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume.

The contents leaf for pt. 2. calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent.

Pt. 1 contains a text printed on a full size sheet headed "To the King's Most Excellent Majesty." It is signed J. F. W. Des Barres and relates to his appointment in 1784 to the governorship of Cape Breton. It is not recorded in the Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Pt. 1 contains also the "Preface."
L.C. copy imperfect: Title pages and prelim. leaves, except the leaf of "References," wanting in pts. 1 and 2.
Includes 14 separate plates of views.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

results.title: The Atlantic Neptune, published for the use of the Royal Navy of Great Britain,

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 15, with 80 items. The first chart in the volume, "The coast of Nova Scotia, New England, New York, New Jersey, the Gulph and River of St. Lawrence," with imprint date Nov. 1, 1780, has an engr. note referring to the fishing rights of the French and the Americans, presumably added after the Treaty of Paris, 1783. Charts and views dated 1774 to 1781. Prelim. leaves include the "Preface," printed on a full sheet. No table of contents is included. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
notes: L.C. copy no. 15, with 80 items.

The first chart in the volume, "The coast of Nova Scotia, New England, New York, New Jersey, the Gulph and River of St. Lawrence," with imprint date Nov. 1, 1780, has an engr. note referring to the fishing rights of the French and the Americans, presumably added after the Treaty of Paris, 1783.
Charts and views dated 1774 to 1781.
Prelim. leaves include the "Preface," printed on a full sheet. No table of contents is included.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

notes: L.C. copy no. 16: v. 3 only, with 40 items.
Charts dated 1775 to 1780.
Undated ed. in 3 volumes, called part I, part II, and part III in their respective tables of contents.
The general t.p., without volume numbering or imprint, and the prelim. leaves are repeated in each volume.

The contents leaf for pt. 2 calls for a chart of Prince Edward's Island instead of St. John's Island as on the relevant chart in the volume. St. John's Island (Isle of St. John) was renamed Prince Edward Island in 1798, after Edward, Duke of Kent.
The contents leaf for pt. 2 in this copy belongs in v. 2; table of contents for pt. 3 wanting.
L.C. copy imperfect: v. 1 and 2 wanting.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 17, with 154 items. Vol. 1 has imprint date 1780; v. 2 has general t.p. dated 1781, and 3 sectional title pages dated 1781, 1780, and 1780 respectively. Charts dated 1774 to 1782. Vol. 1 includes the "Preface," followed by "Contents of the charts," engraved on 1 leaf, listing 3 to 36 numbered items in 2 columns, an inserted title, no. 7**, being in manuscript. The engr. items are followed by the price of the sheet in shillings. Vol. 2 has ms. table headed "Contents, vol. II," listing items 1-55, 60-75. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: v. 1. The sea coast of Nova Scotia.--v. 2. Charts of the coast and harbours in the Gulph & River of St. Lawrence. Charts of the coast and harbors of New England. contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 20, with 25 items. Consists of the New England section only, in contemporary binding, probably issued in 1780. The general t.p. to v. 1 accompanying it, however, belongs with the Nova Scotia series of charts. In various dated "editions" the New England charts appear with general title pages called v. 2, 3, or 4, but not v. 1. The printed sectional t.p. is undated, and includes the reference to Lord Howe. The printed contents leaf which follows has ms. additions. Of the 23 items listed, no. 9, 12, and 23 are added in ms. No. 16 is omitted. The charts, dated 1775 to 1776, are all 1st or 2d states of the plates, on heavy paper with the "LVG-IV" watermark. L.C. copy imperfect: chart no. 11 of the contents leaf, "The Coast from Newbury to Cape Elizabeth," wanting; 3 other charts are incomplete, especially no. 23, "Grand Bay of Passamaquody," which lacks the "Grand Manan Island" section. In ms. on fly leaf preceding the general t.p.: War Office of the United States. May 7th 1790. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: Charts of the coasts and harbours of New England.
contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
notes: L.C. copy no. 20, with 25 items.

Consists of the New England section only, in contemporary binding, probably issued in 1780. The general t.p. to v. 1 accompanying it, however, belongs with the Nova Scotia series of charts. In various dated "editions" the New England charts appear with general title pages called v. 2, 3, or 4, but not v. 1.
The printed sectional t.p. is undated, and includes the reference to Lord Howe.
The printed contents leaf which follows has ms. additions. Of the 23 items listed, no. 9, 12, and 23 are added in ms. No. 16 is omitted.
The charts, dated 1775 to 1776, are all 1st or 2d states of the plates, on heavy paper with the "LVG-IV" watermark.

L.C. copy imperfect: chart no. 11 of the contents leaf, "The Coast from Newbury to Cape Elizabeth," wanting; 3 other charts are incomplete, especially no. 23, "Grand Bay of Passamaquody," which lacks the "Grand Manan Island" section.
In ms. on fly leaf preceding the general t.p.: War Office of the United States. May 7th 1790.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

results.title: The Atlantic Neptune, published for the use of the Royal Navy of Great Britain,

contributor: des barres, joseph f. w. (joseph frederick wallet)
description: L.C. copy no. 22. Charts dated 1777 to 1780. Consists of the St. Lawrence and New York sections of the Atlantic Neptune, which in early "editions" formed b. 4, in 2 unnumbered pts., of the four series of charts. Each section has its own special t.p., but the general t.p. is wanting, probably indicating that this copy was sold separately. Presumably both sectional title pages in this copy were dated 1780, but the title of the St. Lawrence section is mutilated and the date has disappeared. The St. Lawrence title is without the reference to Lord Howe. The tables of contents for each section, without heading or numbering, are engraved on separate narrow leaves mounted on a full sheet. Each item is followed by the price in shillings. Beneath the engr. St. Lawrence contents is a manuscript list duplicating both engr. lists, with 3 charts and a plate of views added. Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: Charts of the coast and harbours in the Gulph & River St. Lawrence. Charts of several harbours, and divers parts of the coast of North America, from New York south westwards to the Gulph of Mexico.
contributors: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
medium: 1 portfolio ([3] l., 26 charts, col. plate) 80 cm.
notes: L.C. copy no. 22.
Charts dated 1777 to 1780.

Consists of the St. Lawrence and New York sections of the Atlantic Neptune, which in early "editions" formed b. 4, in 2 unnumbered pts., of the four series of charts. Each section has its own special t.p., but the general t.p. is wanting, probably indicating that this copy was sold separately.

Presumably both sectional title pages in this copy were dated 1780, but the title of the St. Lawrence section is mutilated and the date has disappeared. The St. Lawrence title is without the reference to Lord Howe.

The tables of contents for each section, without heading or numbering, are engraved on separate narrow leaves mounted on a full sheet. Each item is followed by the price in shillings. Beneath the engr. St. Lawrence contents is a manuscript list duplicating both engr. lists, with 3 charts and a plate of views added.
Cf. H. N. Stevens. Catalogue of the Henry Newton Stevens collection of the Atlantic Neptune.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
